author: Jack Bamford
title: Chelsea Secures Defensively Talented Maelys Mpome Through 2028
text:
Chelsea’s Women’s Super League champions have made a significant addition to their squad by signing defender Maelys Mpome from Montpellier on a contract that extends until 2028.

Toggle

The 21-year-old French international primarily operates as a centre-back. She made her move to Montpellier in 2020, where she has since made 42 appearances for the club, contributing three goals during her tenure.
Player’s Statement Upon joining Chelsea, Mpome expressed her excitement, stating that becoming a Chelsea player feels like “just like living a dream to join such a big club.”
Management’s Perspective Paul Green, the general manager of Chelsea, praised Mpome’s capabilities, highlighting her “good experience for her age” garnered through her development at Montpellier. He noted, “She is a tall and athletic defender whose profile we believe will suit the WSL.”
Upcoming Matches Chelsea is set to kick off their WSL title defense against Aston Villa on September 20 at 19:00 BST.
